definitions.definition: Having to do with people and government office as opposed to the military or religion.
examples: She went into civil service because she wanted to help the people.

definitions.definition: Behaving in a reasonable or polite manner; avoiding displays of hostility .
examples: It was very civil of him to stop the argument.
They despise each other, but they are always civil in public.

definitions.definition: In a peaceful and well-ordered state .
Relating to private relations among citizens, as opposed to criminal matters.

main_definition: ( not comparable ) Having to do with people and government office as opposed to the military or religion.
secondary_definitions: ( comparable ) Behaving in a reasonable or polite manner; avoiding displays of hostility .
( archaic ) In a peaceful and well-ordered state .
( law ) Relating to private relations among citizens, as opposed to criminal matters.
